Package com.rubynaxela.kyanite.game

Class GameContext

java.lang.Object
com.rubynaxela.kyanite.game.GameContext
public final class GameContext extends Object
Provides a set of references to the basic objects used by the game. The instance of this class can be accessed via the getInstance() method. Only one GameContext instance can exist in a single game instance.

    • getInstance

      public static GameContext getInstance()

    • setupWindow

      @Contract("_, _ -> new") public Window setupWindow(@NotNull @NotNull org.jsfml.system.Vector2i size, @NotNull @NotNull String title)
      Sets the window size and title. This has to be called before the window is used. If this method has been called previously, window initializaion is skipped.
      Parameters:
      size - the window size
      title - the window title
      Returns:
      the reference to the window

    • restartGame

      public void restartGame()
      Stops all sounds, restarts the game clock and re-creates the game window. Does not stop any actions that are not handled by the game loop, e.g. running threads.

    • putResource

      public void putResource(@NotNull @NotNull String key, @Nullable @Nullable Object value)
      Stores a resource in the game context storage which can be later retrieved using the specified key. The resource can be any object that will be used in multiple places throughout the game, for instance, game progress data.
      Parameters:
      key - the resource key
      value - the resource to be stored

    • getResource

      public <T> T getResource(@NotNull @NotNull String key)
      Returns the resource associated with the specified key.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the resource
      Parameters:
      key - a resource key
      Returns:
      the resource associated with the specified key
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if the generic type doesn't match the type of the resource
